name: Azul
premise: Players are artisans decorating the walls of the Royal Palace of Evora with stunning tiles.
description: Azul is a tile-placement game in which players take turns drafting colored tiles to their player board. Points are scored based on how they've placed their tiles to decorate the palace.
session_playtime_notes: Game length tends to be consistent.
immersiveness_level_notes: The game's beautiful components and strategic depth provide a good level of engagement.
learning_curve_notes: The game is easy to learn but offers deep strategic decisions.
save_mechanism_notes: Games are played in one session.
how_to_win: Score the most points through strategic tile placement.
how_to_lose: Having fewer points than the other players at the end of the game.

reasons: Azul requires careful planning and foresight to win.

unique_selling_point: Azul combines simple rules with deep strategic gameplay and beautiful components.
